caption:
This image features a man’s hands holding a measuring device, which appears to be a sound level meter, used to assess noise pollution or environmental noise. The device is black, with a gray top housing and several controls. Prominently displayed on the front is a gauge with a scale and a needle showing the measurement. The gauge is labeled in both dB(A) and dB(C) scales, typical for sound measurement.

The man’s hands are partially visible; he is wearing a watch and a patterned, long-sleeved shirt. The setting suggests an outdoor urban environment, possibly near industrial facilities given the presence of what appears to be factory-like structures and metal fencing in the blurred background. The environment and the device suggest that the photograph could be documenting an environmental study or noise pollution measurement.
title: Noise meter, held at Logan Airport end of Neptune Road records over 86 decibels.
